intro: Linaria arvensis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb with slender stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its flowers are arranged in spikes and bloom from late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its narrow leaves and is often mistaken for other members of the Scrophulariaceae family.
